snippet: The Super Bowl, new digital streaming TV deals and higher fees for its cable networks resulted in a stronger-than-expected gain in quarterly profit at 21st Century Fox.
abstract: Media company 21st Century Fox reports net income of $1.05 billion in its fiscal third quarter, or 47 cents a share, down from $2.9 billion, or $1.22 a share, a year earlier; per-share profit rose to 47 cents from 32 cents; revenue climbed 12 percent, to $8.22 billion; it is company's third fiscal period since separating from publishing-oriented News Corporation.
lead_paragraph: The Super Bowl, new digital streaming TV deals and higher fees for its cable networks resulted in a stronger-than-expected gain in quarterly profit at 21st Century Fox.

headline.main: Cable Fees and Football Help Profits Climb at Fox
headline.print_headline: Cable Fees and Football Help Profits Climb at Fox
